intro: Cleistes macrantha, commonly known as the sacred lotus of the Americas, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, showy, violet-blue flowers that resemble miniature lotuses. The plant is herbaceous, with hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in wetlands and marshy areas, preferring partial to full sun and moist, well-drained soil. Cleistes macrantha is also known for its fragrant blooms and is considered a rare and endangered species in some regions.
